byline.original: LONDON TIMES -- NEW YORK TIMES Special Cablegram

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8. -- Expressions of condolence from all quarters of the world continue to flow in upon the State Department. To-day's messages were largely from crowned heads and Governments. Among them were the following:
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 8. -- Expressions of condolence from all quarters of the world continue to flow in upon the State Department. To-day's messages were largely from crowned heads and Governments. Among them were the following:

headline.main: WORLD-WIDE SYMPATHY.; Messages of Condolence on the President's Assassination Pour In.
THE FLORAL OFFERINGS.; Rarest and Costliest Blossoms Surround the Vault Where Mr. McKinley's Body Lies.
COMMERCE OF THE WORLD; Averaged Figures Show Balance Against Twenty Countries. The United States Leads in Value of Exports Over Imports -- Great Britain Leads the Other Way.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 4 -- At this morning's session of the Pan-American Congress a note was read from the Spanish Minister, Marquis de Prat, conveying the thanks of the Chamber of Deputies of Madrid, for the friendly sentiments of the conference toward...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 4 -- At this morning's session of the Pan-American Congress a note was read from the Spanish Minister, Marquis de Prat, conveying the thanks of the Chamber of Deputies of Madrid, for the friendly sentiments of the conference toward Spain, as wired by Gen. Reyes, delegate of Colombia, and expressed at the municipal banquet.

headline.main: PAN-AMERICAN CONGRESS.; Message of Thanks from Spanish Chamber Read.

byline.original: LONDON TIMES -- NEW YORK TIMES Special Cablegram

docs.snippet: To the Editor of The New York Times: The conflict of testimony in the Schley court of inquiry as regards time, distances, , has recalled an episode that occurred in 1884 at Maldonado Bay, Uruguay. The Nipsic had gone there in order to have small-arm...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of The New York Times: The conflict of testimony in the Schley court of inquiry as regards time, distances, , has recalled an episode that occurred in 1884 at Maldonado Bay, Uruguay. The Nipsic had gone there in order to have small-arm target practice on Lobos Island, at the entrance to the bay.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 -- The State Department received dispatches from the City of Mexico making clear for the first time what is to be expected on the subject of arbitration, which has been the most important and the most difficult problem before the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 30 -- The State Department received dispatches from the City of Mexico making clear for the first time what is to be expected on the subject of arbitration, which has been the most important and the most difficult problem before the Congress of American Republics. The advices came from Mr. Buchanan, the United States delegate, who was assigned to look after this particular question.

headline.main: THE AMERICAN REPUBLICS' ATTITUDE TO ARBITRATION.; Minority of the States Represented at the Pan-American Congress Want It to be Compulsory.
